Question: In October 1926, this person and Olgivanna were accused of violating the Mann Act and arrested in Tonka Bay, Minnesota.
Hints: For more conservative clients, this person conceded to design more traditional dwellings.
This person authored 20 books and many articles and was a popular lecturer in the United States and in Europe.
Two, the Hickox and Bradley Houses, were the last transitional step between this person's early designs and the Prairie creations.
